name: Tds3301tutorial
tagline: General Repository for tutorial work related to MMU course TDS 3301 ( Data Mining )
body:
# TDS3301 Tutorial Work

by Darrel Shakri Bin Ahmad Shakri

# About Apatar

Apatar is a data integration tool created in Java that is open-sourced, and is currently capable of importing data from multiple database systems.

Apatar uses a visual mapping tool to make connections to database sources, transforming the data, and to set up a unified schema for providing a single view of the data integrated.

## Data Sources Apatar can integrate

Apatar is capable of integrating data from various database systems, such as :
+ Oracle
+ MS SQL
+ MySQL
+ Sybase
+ DB2
+ MS Access
+ PostgreSQL
+ XML
+ MS Excel
+ ... any JDBC data sources and more

## Relevance in Big Data

Before any type of data mining can be done, the data in which the data mining step performs on must be consistent, useful and representative of the relevant dataset we would want to work on.

Apatar is able to connect to database source of various types and schemas, and allows the user to perform data cleansing in order to produce a singular, consistent view of the aggregated data. This will assisting in creating datasets that can be trusted to perform data mining.

## Use for R

While Apatar is an open-source application, there are no documented method of integrating Apatar into Rstudio.
